question_text: Which statement best contrasts modular and non-modular laptop battery designs?
answer_options: Non-modular batteries can only be charged via external docks
Modular batteries are harder to install due to their location inside the chassis
Modular batteries promote field-serviceability while non-modular batteries require internal access
Both battery types can be hot-swapped during operation
correct_answer: Modular batteries promote field-serviceability while non-modular batteries require internal access
explanation: Modular batteries allow user-level replacement; non-modular batteries often require full device disassembly.
